intro: Tetrastigma cambodianum, commonly known as the Cambodian ivy, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are usually yellow or orange when ripe and contain several seeds. Tetrastigma cambodianum is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
